description.narrative: In April 2021 India started experiencing a second wave of COVID-19 which has caused record daily cases in any country since the start of the pandemic. It is now the country recording the highest daily infection levels worldwide. India became the first nation to record in excess of 400,000 new cases in one day, with 412, 431 cases being recorded on Friday 30th April. As of 6th May, more than 300,000 new cases have been reported every day for the last 12 days.Â The peak of this second wave in India is predicted by mid-May, where it is expected there will be around 35 million active cases of COVID-19, or 5,600 new cases per day. The Indian RCS has released a Plan of Action asking for 17.7m CHF to support the response to the second wave.
